teaching_cue: Suppose you didn't understand what was said. How would you ask something like "how's that?" or "what?"

phrase: Est-ce que vous avez des dollars?
teaching_cue: Ask someone if he has some dollars.

phrase: Est-ce que vous avez du vin?
teaching_cue: Ask him if he has some wine.
How does he tell you he has no wine?
Say, "Well then, give me one franc."

phrase: Mais la bière est pour Georges.
teaching_cue: Say, "But the beer is for Georges."
Here is how to say, "You can."

phrase: Est-ce que vous pouvez manger maintenant?

teaching_cue: Tell him you don't want to.

phrase: Est-ce que vous avez du vin?
teaching_cue: Ask the young woman if she has some wine.

phrase: Est-ce que vous avez de la bière?
teaching_cue: Ask her if she has any beer.

phrase: Est-ce que vous avez des dollars?
teaching_cue: Ask her if she has any dollars.
How does she say, "I have many"?
Suppose she doesn't have any, what would she say?
How would she say she doesn't have many?
Now, try to say, "I want some."
Now, try to say, "You want some."
And now just say, "I haven't any."
Look at number four. The word in the middle, E-T, is also pronounced "É."
